sn47.34:1.1: “Mendicants, when these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.
sn47.34:2.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.34:2.3: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.34:2.5: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.34:2.6: When these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to going from the near shore to the far shore.”
